meanings.definition: The inner self of an individual.
meanings.sent1: She always trusted her animas to guide her in making decisions.
meanings.sent2: His animas seemed to shine through his kind actions towards others.
meanings.sent3: When her animas decided to take a break, she felt lost without its guidance.
meanings.sent4: The animas of the forest whispered secrets to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent5: The animas of the old house seemed to linger long after its inhabitants had left.

meanings.definition: The vital principle in living beings.
meanings.sent1: The animas within the seed holds the potential for new life.
meanings.sent2: Doctors work tirelessly to preserve the animas of their patients.
meanings.sent3: The animas of the party was the lively music that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the night, the animas of the city seemed to pulse with energy.
meanings.sent5: The animas of the ocean could be felt in the crashing waves and salty breeze.

meanings.sent1: Her animas felt at peace when surrounded by nature's beauty.
meanings.sent2: The animas of the old storyteller seemed to carry wisdom beyond his years.
meanings.sent3: When the animas of the partygoers collided, laughter filled the room.
meanings.sent4: The animas of the mountain climber soared as he reached the summit.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet church, the animas of the hymns lifted the spirits of the congregation.
